translation.en: [host] Yes, it is actually confirmed.
1.6-million-dollar prize pool!
I'm double-checking to make sure they haven't changed any details since last time.
translation.ko: 혹시 변경된 사항은 없는지 한 번 더 확인 중입니다

translation.en: One million in US dollars for first prize.
That is for the winner. One million dollars for winning Dota!
translation.ko: 바로 우승자의 몫입니다 '도타'에서 우승하면 무려 백만 달러를 버는 거죠!

translation.en: It's gonna be huge. Dota2.com. The tournament tab is up, too.
translation.ko: 어마어마한 대회가 될 겁니다 '도타' 홈페이지에 대회 전용 탭도 열렸습니다

translation.en: Our website will actually change for the next 24 hours as well, so you get to read all the details…
translation.ko: 저희 웹사이트도 24시간 안에 바뀔 테니 확인해 보시죠…

translation.en: [hyhy] The day I transformed into an adult was the day I started playing Dota.
It's times like, when you go up on the stage,
you represent your country for something.
You get the prize. It's the amount of satisfaction and achievement
that nothing else can give you.
translation.ko: 다른 데서는 결코 느낄 수 없어요

translation.en: It's something I definitely don't regret ever doing.
Gaming is simply the proudest thing in my life.
[Dendi] It can be called "gamer," but for me, it's something different.
translation.ko: 사람들은 '게이머'라고 하지만 저한테는 더한 의미가 있어요

translation.en: One way to forget about pain is to do something that you will be in completely.
translation.ko: 고통을 잊으려면 완전히 몰입할 일을 하면 되는데

translation.en: So… computer games.
For me, it was… everything.
[Fear] This is my career. I've chosen to do it for so long.
translation.ko: 이게 제 일이고 이 길을 선택한 지 오래됐어요

translation.en: Success in my eyes is always based off on how other people see you.
translation.ko: 제 기준에서 성공은 언제나 남들의 시각에 달렸죠

translation.en: In the eyes of the public, it's up to them.
translation.ko: 대중이 어떻게 봐 주느냐 거기에 달려 있어요

translation.en: [hyhy] It's important to be doing things that you love and you really appreciate,
translation.ko: 좋아하고 감사할 수 있는 일을 하는 게 중요해요

translation.en: because that's your passion, man.
You should… you should really work for your passions.
Okay, guys, you have… you have seven minutes to set everything up and then we go.
translation.ko: 준비 시간 7분 남았습니다 그 후에 바로 시작합니다

translation.en: [Fear] This is the first time I wanted to take something seriously
translation.ko: 이렇게 진지하게 여기고 이루길 바란 일은

translation.en: and do something good for my life.
translation.ko: 이렇게 진지하게 여기고 이루길 바란 일은 이번이 처음이에요

translation.en: [Troels] Ten years ago, competitive gaming wasn't even really a thing.
translation.ko: 10년 전의 게임 대회는 대회라 하기도 민망했죠

translation.en: You'd play for fun against your friends.
translation.ko: 그냥 친구들과 재미로 붙어 보는 거였어요

translation.en: Maybe you would play for a cup of coffee or whatever you wanted.
translation.ko: 커피 같은 걸 걸고 뭐 그런 식으로요

translation.en: [Alexander] When I started playing,
translation.ko: 제가 게임을 시작할 때 처음 참가했던 대회는

translation.en: we'd been fighting for 24 bottles of beer as a first place.
translation.ko: 제가 게임을 시작할 때 처음 참가했던 대회는 1등 상품이 맥주 24병이었죠

translation.en: I'm not joking.
[Jon] From there, though, online happened.
And, all of a sudden, you weren't just trying to be the best on your block.
translation.ko: 갑자기 딴 세상이 되었어요 동네 1등을 목표로 하다가

translation.en: [Jon] Now you're trying to be the best in the world.
And that opened up competitive gaming to a whole new landscape.
translation.ko: 그때부터 게임 대회는 완전히 새로운 국면을 맞이했어요

translation.en: And one of the games really leading the way is Dota.
translation.ko: 그 변화를 이끈 게임은 바로 '도타'라 생각해요

translation.en: [Liu] Dota is sort of a combination of football, or soccer for the Americans, and chess.
translation.ko: 말하자면 '도타'는 축구와 체스를 합한 것과 같아요

translation.en: This is probably how I would try to explain Dota to someone who's not familiar with it.
translation.ko: 저는 '도타'를 잘 모르는 사람한테 이런 식으로 설명해요

translation.en: At least, that's what I did to my parents.
[host] Dota is a game of momentum.
You as five players
try and battle against the other five players for momentum.
translation.ko: 상대 팀 다섯 명과 싸워 기세를 몰아가는 거죠

translation.en: Every single player controls one unit.
And the main objective of the game is to destroy the final enemy building
translation.ko: 고대의 요새라는 적의 핵심 건물을 파괴하는 게

translation.en: which is called the "Ancient."
[host] Everything else that happens in the meantime,
is your amazing filler of a game.
[Jeremy] You could play 100 heroes in conjunction with 99 other heroes.
translation.ko: 100명의 영웅을 다른 99명의 영웅과 조합해서 함께 플레이할 수 있기에

translation.en: It's just nonstop, uh, possibilities and it's so much fun.
translation.ko: 일어날 수 있는 상황이 무궁무진하니까 재미있을 수밖에 없죠

translation.en: And, you know, it's like the same map every single time
but it literally never gets boring.
[Jeremy] I would say Dota is a way of life.
[Clement] When prizes started coming, I was like, "Well, we have tournaments."
translation.ko: 상금이 걸리기 시작했을 때 대회가 생겼으니

translation.en: So obviously some people are gonna come and say,
"This is a great game. Let's play it. Like, let's put money in it."
translation.ko: '이 게임 재밌으니 해 볼까? 돈 좀 써 볼까?'

translation.en: [Clement] And it started progressing each year.
[Tammy] Those at the top level,
they just do like lots of calculations in their head.
Something like A Beautiful Mind where you see like all kinds of things.
translation.ko: 영화 '뷰티풀 마인드'처럼 모든 것을 다 재 본 다음에

translation.en: [Tammy] And using all this information, make your next move.
I see it in a lot of ways similar to basketball.
Just like a five-on-five game where you kind of have to work together
translation.ko: 5대5 경기인 데다 팀원 모두가 협동해야 하고

translation.en: and utilize each other's strengths and synergizing everything together.
translation.ko: 각자 장점을 발휘해서 시너지를 내는 점 등

translation.en: The teamwork, and the trust, and the sacrifice,
those are all true for every single team sport.
Dota is a game that unites everybody.
It doesn't matter what country or from what race you are.
It's like a bond that is shared.
And when you're part of this tight-knit group of people,
it's like having a second family.
That's something you never let go.
[Tammy] Everyone's searching for something.
Fulfillment. Fame.
Satisfaction.
It gives you the ability to become someone else.
translation.ko: '도타'에서는 내가 아닌 다른 존재가 될 수 있어요

translation.en: A someone who is powerful.
Who can take down five opponents.
Express their creativity.
Break the rules without actually getting arrested.
All of these reasons are in there somewhere.
translation.ko: 아무튼 게임을 하다 보면 이런 바람이 다 충족되죠

translation.en: The player himself might not even know. He might not even understand it himself.
translation.ko: 플레이어 자신도 뭔지 모르고 제대로 이해하지 못하더라도

translation.en: But it's there.
translation.ko: 그 바람이 분명히 채워져요 "태미 탕 팀 매니저 / 프로게이머"

translation.en: [Fear] Gaming fulfills my competitive need.
I'm a very competitive person.
When it comes to sports, I consider gaming a sport.
So I use my competitiveness and I fuel it with Dota.
So it fulfills that side of me completely.
Fear's one of the best in America, if not the best.
He has a lot of experience. He's one of the old hogs, basically.
And he's generally just a calm guy. So, in my opinion, that's his strength.
translation.ko: 보통은 조용한 성격이지만요 제 생각엔 그게 장점인 것 같아요

translation.en: Really, good basketball player. I remember my coaches watch him playing
translation.ko: 굉장한 농구 선수였어요 아직도 기억나는 게 코치들이 지켜보면서

translation.en: and talk about picking him up the next year he came in.
Always had nothing but good things to say, but he wasn't picked on the team.
translation.ko: 항상 칭찬만 했었는데 선수로 발탁되진 않았어요

translation.en: Just the reason was, yeah, he just wasn't tall enough, I guess.
translation.ko: 키가 좀 작아서 그랬던 것 같아요

translation.en: So, I know that, yeah, he found the game.
He got really devoted in that and stuff and just found something else that worked.
translation.ko: 게임에 계속 전념하다가 자기 길을 찾은 거죠

translation.en: [Karen] I was your typical parent.
"Clinton, you're spending too much time playing computer games."
"You need to go to school. You need to go to college."
[Karen] And he would tell me,
"I want to be able to play games and get paid for it."
Now, he said this at a very young age before Dota ever came along.
translation.ko: 그렇게 얘기한 게 아주 어릴 때였어요 '도타'가 나오기 훨씬 전이죠

translation.en: [Karen] And I thought, well, you know, he's gonna grow out of it.
He's gonna get sick and tired of sitting there
translation.ko: 모니터 앞에 딱 붙어 계속 게임하는 것도

translation.en: in front of that computer and playing.
translation.ko: 모니터 앞에 딱 붙어 계속 게임하는 것도 언젠간 질릴 테니까요

translation.en: Never did. Never did.
[hyhy] In Singapore, the families actually put a lot of stress on us
translation.ko: 싱가포르에서는 가족이 교육으로 많이 압박하는 편이에요

translation.en: in terms of our education.
I would say it's been tough on me
trying to juggle both studies and gaming at the same time.
translation.ko: 공부와 게임을 동시에 잘하려 하니 꽤 힘들었어요 "hyhy 베네딕트 림 Scythe 소속"

translation.en: My grades have dropped for two years already.
And my parents have treated the gaming as the cause of it.
I mean, there was this phrase that they used.
They said, "Gaming will be the death of you one day."
-[indistinct chatter] -[all cheer]
[Toh] He's a great player and a great captain.
I would say he's the top player in Singapore.
translation.ko: 싱가포르 최고 선수죠 "토웨이홍 Scythe 소속 프로게이머"

translation.en: Easily.
[hyhy] My parents and my… my family,
they don't actually speak much of my gaming career.
translation.ko: 제가 게이머라는 얘기를 별로 하지 않아요

translation.en: They don't tell their friends and my other relatives
translation.ko: 친구분들이나 친척들한테 제가 게임을 아주 잘한다는 얘기를 안 하시죠

translation.en: that I'm actually that good at my games.
translation.ko: 제가 게임을 아주 잘한다는 얘기를 안 하시죠

translation.en: All along they have only been bragging about my studies.
translation.ko: 반면 제 성적은 항상 자랑하시곤 했어요

translation.en: Because I used to be an "A" student.
Yeah, they go on and on. And…
And it seemed like that was the only thing they could ever be proud of.
translation.ko: 공부 말고는 자랑거리가 될 수 없는 것처럼요

translation.en: [hyhy] Actually, there has only been one person
translation.ko: 제가 게임하는 것을 응원하고 지지해 준 사람이

translation.en: that has always been very supportive of me gaming.
translation.ko: 제가 게임하는 것을 응원하고 지지해 준 사람이 딱 한 명 있었는데

translation.en: And that was, uh, my ex-girlfriend, Huayan.
She's from the female Dota team in Singapore.
There are a lot of things that we share in life.
So many things.
In my case, it felt really good, you know, to have someone
translation.ko: 저는 그냥 제가 잘하는 일을 진심으로 인정해 주고

translation.en: who truly appreciated what you did best and loved you for it.
translation.ko: 저는 그냥 제가 잘하는 일을 진심으로 인정해 주고 그런 저를 사랑해 줘서 정말 좋았어요

translation.en: She was aware of what I'm doing and what I'm passionate about.
The breakup was her decision and I respected it.
translation.ko: 헤어지자고 한 건 후아얀이고 전 그 뜻을 따랐죠

translation.en: We'd been together for close to three years
and ever since the breakup, I haven't gotten over it.
I recall the last time she spoke to me she named me as a bastard, so…
translation.ko: 마지막으로 연락했을 때 나쁜 놈이랬으니까 뭐…

translation.en: We're not in contact anymore, yeah, but…
life goes on, yeah.
-[man singing] -[gentle music playing]
[Dendi] I'm from Ukraine. My nickname is Dendi.
I finished my university,
and I'm just playing computer games right now.
translation.ko: 지금은 게임만 하죠 "Dendi 다닐 이슈튼 Na'Vi 소속"

translation.en: [in Russian] He was doing music. He played the piano.
[Irina, in Russian] He was doing dancing.
At school, he had musical plays in which he played the main role.
Audiences were always impressed by his artistic ability.
translation.ko: 예술 감각이 뛰어나 항상 사람들이 놀라곤 했죠

translation.en: When their kids' group was showing, Danil would always stand out.
translation.ko: 단체로 무슨 공연이라도 하면 항상 제일 돋보였어요

translation.en: [Katya] When we were growing up,
it wasn't a good time financially for our family.
But my grandma helped us to get our first computer in 1997.
translation.ko: 그런데 1997년에 할머니께서 첫 컴퓨터를 사 주셨어요

translation.en: Early, compared with other kids in Ukraine.
translation.ko: 그 당시의 다른 또래들보다 빨리 마련한 편이었죠

translation.en: We got visitors every day.
The friends of my older brother used to come to visit us
and we were playing games.
[Artem] And Danil, every time looked at what we do.
Every time we would try to push him away but he would come back and look again.
translation.ko: 매번 저리 가라고 쫓아내도 다시 와서 또 보곤 했어요

translation.en: [Irina, in Russian] It was more prominent with him than with other kids.
During all his conscious life we were trying to stop him from playing.
translation.ko: 다닐이 제법 컸을 때부터 게임 못 하게 하려고

translation.en: [Katya] We were hiding our computer cord everywhere in our apartment,
but he always found it.
[in Russian] I always wanted to understand him better.
translation.ko: 언제나 이 아이를 더 잘 이해하고 싶었어요

translation.en: Including that hobby, I wanted to understand him better.
translation.ko: 게임하는 것까지 포함해서 애를 더 잘 알고 싶었죠

translation.en: [Irina, in Russian] There were certain reasons. I'm not going to mention them now.
translation.ko: 분명한 이유가 있었는데 지금 얘기하진 않을 거예요

translation.en: I think somewhere deep inside he's a little bit sad.
translation.ko: 그냥 마음속 깊이 어딘가에 슬픔이 있었던 것 같아요

translation.en: [Katya] Uh, she stopped preventing him from playing Dota.
translation.ko: 엄마는 '도타'를 못 하게 막는 걸 그만두셨어요

translation.en: She gave Dendi the freedom to choose what is the best for him and his life.
translation.ko: Dendi에게 자신과 자기 삶을 위한 최선을 선택할 자유를 주신 거죠

translation.en: [Dominik] Tournaments back then were like really low prizes.
translation.ko: "The International 발표 '도타 2' 챔피언십" 당시 대회 상금은 정말 적었어요

translation.en: And a lot of prize money didn't even get to the players.
translation.ko: 심지어 선수가 상금을 못 받는 일도 허다했죠

translation.en: There's been a lot of scams with the managers and stuff like that.
translation.ko: 매니저나 그런 사람들이 사기를 치는 일이 꽤 많았거든요

translation.en: [Dominik] There were, like, some rumors
translation.ko: "우승 상금" 우승 상금이 5만 달러라는 소문이 돌았고

translation.en: that it's gonna be, like, 50,000 dollars, first place,
and everyone was going, like, "Nah, it's not gonna be like that."
translation.ko: 우승 상금이 5만 달러라는 소문이 돌았고 다들 '설마, 그럴 리가 없어' 하는 반응을 보였죠

translation.en: [host] Watch the forums go nuts, guys.
Watch the forums go nuts.
It is actually confirmed.
It is off the fricking hook.
1.6-million-dollar prize pool!
That is for the winner, one million dollars for winning Dota!
translation.ko: 바로 우승자의 몫입니다 '도타'에서 우승하면 무려 백만 달러를 버는 거죠! "백만 달러래!"

translation.en: [Rasmus] Dota, the game I've played for five years now,
which I played for fun,
for some food money or whatever, you know,
okay, it's actually getting big.
It's the largest prize pool of any gaming competition to date.
translation.ko: 상금이 게임 대회 역사상 최고 수준이에요

translation.en: [Tammy] It just felt like the start of something big.
Like a revolution.
[Rasmus] You know, we had everything we needed
translation.ko: 이 게임이 e스포츠로 인정받는 데 필요한

translation.en: for the game to become big and respected as an E-Sport.
translation.ko: 이 게임이 e스포츠로 인정받는 데 필요한 모든 게 있었어요

translation.en: It would kind of like vindicate us.
[Tammy] We're not just playing because we're addicted.
There's a goal, a motive.
translation.ko: 잘만 하면 실제로 이룰 수 있는

translation.en: That we can actually reach out and grab if we are good enough.
translation.ko: 목표가 있고 이유가 있어서 플레이하는 거니까요

translation.en: Over in Asia, professional gamers are treated like rock stars.
It's a viable career opportunity.
translation.ko: 성공을 노려볼 수 있는 직업인 거죠

translation.en: They actually live in gamer houses.
So it's set up to be a thing all year long.
I think their approach to practice is that it's like a day job.
[Liu] The fan base is immense.
It probably is as big as the whole Western audience together.
translation.ko: 서양 관중을 전부 합친 정도쯤 될 거예요

translation.en: Or even more than that.
So now you really have to play good. You really have to try hard.
translation.ko: 그러니까 진짜 잘해야죠 진짜 열심히 노력하고요

translation.en: [Fear] It's first place. It's go big or go home.
translation.ko: 우승해서 대성공하거나 그냥 집에 가는 거죠

translation.en: The big teams get big money.
But the 9th to 16th place earn nothing.
And their salaries are not worth considering.
translation.ko: 월급은 받는다고 말할 수준도 안 되고요

translation.en: While in sports, you have a salary that you can live on.
translation.ko: 운동선수는 생계를 꾸릴 정도의 월급을 받는데

translation.en: [Jeremy] With pro gaming, I think that's one of the toughest parts
translation.ko: 프로게이머는 그렇지 않은 게 가장 힘든 부분이죠

translation.en: is living game to game. It's like living paycheck to paycheck.
translation.ko: 한 경기 한 경기 치르면서 하루 벌어 하루 먹고사는 식이죠

translation.en: Like, I have to win. If I don't win, I don't get paid.
translation.ko: 이기지 않으면 못 버니 이겨야만 해요

translation.en: [Jeremy] That's tough for anybody. It doesn't matter what you're doing.
translation.ko: 그런 식으로 사는 건 직업이 뭐든 간에 힘들어요

translation.en: [Karen] When your child wants to become a professional gamer,
translation.ko: 아이가 프로게이머를 하고 싶다고 할 때

translation.en: you don't have any history to look back on like other sports.
translation.ko: 그 일에 대해 알아볼 선례가 없어요 다른 운동처럼요

translation.en: I don't know anybody who's made a living at gaming.
translation.ko: 게임으로 먹고사는 사람은 한 명도 모르거든요

translation.en: So it's kind of a scary thing
when you see your kid putting their whole life into gaming
translation.ko: 대학 진학이나 일반적인 직업을 갖는 게 아니라

translation.en: and not college and not the traditional things.
[Karen] What if nothing comes of it?
[Alexander] Regarding the age, I think, yes,
translation.ko: e스포츠 선수의 나이는 네, 제 생각으론

translation.en: like, 25, 26 years. It's absolutely maximum for E-Sports.
[Alexander] Because 27, 28, 29, 30, your reaction time is lowering
and you can't click so much, you know…
[chuckles] …as the kids do.
A lot of financial responsibilities are laid upon me right now.
translation.ko: 지금 제가 경제적으로 책임져야 할 부분이 많아서

translation.en: Require me to be successful in something or have a job.
translation.ko: 성공 못 할 거면 다른 직업을 찾아야 해요

translation.en: So it's pretty critical that I am successful if I wanna keep continue, like, the gaming career.
He's an A-Star student, you know?
Because of this gaming, it pulled him right down.
translation.ko: 그런데 이 게임 때문에 바닥으로 떨어졌어요

translation.en: It's very sad for me.
[Vicky] So here… the bad one is Auntie.
Auntie is the one that always comes here and nag, nag, nag, nag, nag.
translation.ko: 올 때마다 항상 하는 건 잔소리뿐이니까

translation.en: -Am I right? -It's tough being a gamer.
translation.ko: - 내 말 맞지? - 게이머도 쉽진 않아요

translation.en: -Huh? Sorry? Am I right? -I said, it's tough being a gamer.
translation.ko: 뭐라고? - 내 말이 맞지 않아? - 게이머도 쉽지 않다고요

translation.en: Huh, hy? Why? Multi-millionaire.
For gaming, huh?
Huh? Sorry, you are not.
Huh? What, what is your view? What is your plan?
That is more important.
translation.ko: 계획이 뭐야? 이게 더 중요한 거지

translation.en: I mean, we speak ourselves. We speak our frank opinion.
translation.ko: 솔직하게 얘기해 보자 툭 터놓고 얘기해 보자고

translation.en: This is your choice now.
What do you want in life? That is more important.
translation.ko: 인생에서 바라는 게 뭐야? 그게 더 중요한 거잖아

translation.en: [hyhy] If I'm gonna win this tournament, my first thought would be,
I will call my… my ex-girlfriend.
translation.ko: 헤어진 여자 친구한테 전화할 것 같아요

translation.en: Things got really bad between us, and…
but right now, for me, if I'm gonna win this tournament,
my first thought would be, I would call her. I'd tell her about it, and…
translation.ko: 제일 먼저 전 여자 친구에게 전화로 우승을 알려 주고

translation.en: I want to share this moment with her. Yeah.
translation.ko: 그 순간을 함께 나누고 싶을 것 같아요 그러네요

translation.en: [James] This tournament is gonna be a moment in every gamer's life.
translation.ko: 이번 대회는 모든 게이머에게 잊을 수 없는 순간일 겁니다

translation.en: Everything that you've been doing is building up
and is gonna happen over one week.
[James] And then it's not one week anymore, it's one game.
translation.ko: 또 생각해 보면 한 경기 만에 결정되는 거고

translation.en: And then it's not that one game, it's that one moment in the game.
translation.ko: 또 그렇게 생각하면 경기 속 딱 한순간에 결정되죠

translation.en: And then that one moment in the game is where it's gonna finish.
translation.ko: 그 순간에 모든 게 결정되는 겁니다

translation.en: And how's it gonna finish? Are you gonna be holding up a trophy?
translation.ko: 어떤 결정이 나느냐면 우승컵을 들고 있거나

translation.en: Or are you gonna be the most disappointed that you've ever been?
It's Tuesday. So one day before the event. We already have a lot of setup.
translation.ko: 화요일이네요 하루 남았어요 준비가 많이 됐습니다

translation.en: We have a lot of computer setup right here.
The whole booth construction is pretty much finished.
So five players per side. They can see each other through the glass.
translation.ko: 한쪽에 다섯 명씩 앉고 유리 너머로 상대를 볼 수 있어요

translation.en: [host] They can't hear each other. This booth is soundproofed up.
translation.ko: 소리를 들을 수는 없죠 방음 부스니까요

translation.en: Plus, the whole setup here,
if you look from above looks exactly like a Dota map.
[host] And this is the mid. This is where it all happens.
translation.ko: 여기가 중부 전선이에요 모든 게 일어날 곳이죠

translation.en: [Moritz] A few teams have already arrived this morning.
translation.ko: 오늘 아침에 벌써 몇 팀이 도착했어요

translation.en: We had a lot of teams from Singapore. We have China.
We had Malaysia coming in and Russia.
And, uh, tomorrow it's finally happening.
[host] We're here live at Gamescom 2011 in beautiful Cologne.
It's the first day of the event.
We've got some of the world's best teams here in Dota.
translation.ko: 전 세계 최고의 '도타' 팀들이 이곳에 모였습니다

translation.en: And they're handing out a tournament prize of 1.6 million dollars!
[host] It is massive here.
A tournament of 1.6 million dollars. That's the future of gaming.
translation.ko: 160만 달러짜리 대회라니 게임의 미래라 할 수 있죠

translation.en: This is awesome!
[host] It's the first time we're gonna see teams of this caliber
translation.ko: 각국의 실력파 팀이 한자리에 모이는 건

translation.en: assembled in one location.
These guys are not just nameless faces.
They're the best in the world.
[Troels] The bunch of teams we have here,
there's a few teams that have individual skill that's unbelievable.
translation.ko: 개개인의 실력이 엄청나게 좋은 팀이 몇 있지만

translation.en: And then there's a big group of other teams
that have good individual skill, not top-notch,
but who win through good strategy and team play.
[Troels] Fear is a great player, for example,
but he is not comparable to good players in Asia.
translation.ko: 아시아 상위 선수들에 비하면 좀 부족한 점이 있죠

translation.en: that's nothing against Fear. He's still an excellent player,
translation.ko: 나쁜 뜻으로 하는 말은 아닙니다 어쨌든 우수한 선수니까요

translation.en: but he's not them.
[James] Over in Asia, they take gaming so much more seriously.
translation.ko: 아시아에서는 게임을 훨씬 더 진지하게 봅니다

translation.en: Just to give you an example,
the Korean football team were playing in the World Cup.
[James] To motivate the Korean football team to play better,
they brought in StarCraft: Brood War professional gamers
into their locker room before they went out
translation.ko: '스타크래프트' 프로게이머들을 로커 룸에서 만나게 했어요 경기 시작 전에 그들의 영웅인 프로게이머를 보게 한 거죠

translation.en: so that they got to meet what were their heroes.
translation.ko: 경기 시작 전에 그들의 영웅인 프로게이머를 보게 한 거죠

translation.en: [Tammy] In China, Dota is to the people there
what StarCraft is to Korea.
Um, it's televised.
The girls like their boyfriends to be Dota players.
After a game, when they're walking around you can see fans running up to them
translation.ko: 게임이 끝나고 선수들이 나올 때 팬들이 마구 달려가서

translation.en: asking them to sign on their shirts.
It's like a real sport.
The third time I was in China, I was playing with fans for two days.
translation.ko: 제가 세 번째로 중국에 갔을 때는 팬들과 이틀 동안 게임을 했고요

translation.en: [Rasmus] They made a video of me, filming me walking in some mountains
and I had to say some sentences and stuff.
And I was like, yeah, "In Dota, there's always a new mountain to climb."
translation.ko: 어떤 거였냐면 ''도타'에는 언제나 새로이 넘어야 할 산이 있습니다'

translation.en: Stuff like this, you know, and, uh…
I walked up and down these stairs
and started running and lifting some weights,
translation.ko: 계단을 오르락내리락하거나 달리기도 하고 역기도 들었죠

translation.en: just to compare this with Dota like some metaphor and stuff.
[Tang, in Chinese] E-Sports in China is already a sport that is recognized
translation.ko: 중국에선 e스포츠가 국가 체육 총국이 인정한

translation.en: by the General Administration of Sport.
It is the same as tennis, ping pong, chess.
The only thing is that it is not an Olympic sport.
[hyhy] I will say that China teams are all great.
translation.ko: 중국 팀은 전부 잘하는 것 같아요

translation.en: Every player in the team is strong.
You don't recognize China players as a player.
You just recognize them as a whole team. You just fear the whole team.
translation.ko: 그냥 한 팀으로 인식되죠 팀 전체가 두려운 존재예요

translation.en: [James] The Chinese teams that have come to this competition
translation.ko: 이번 대회에 참가한 중국 팀 때문에

translation.en: are scaring the shit out of everyone else.
We had two of the top Chinese teams in our group.
translation.ko: 중국 최고 두 팀과 같은 조예요

translation.en: [Liu] Online Kingdom has not been regarded as one of the favorites to win it.
translation.ko: Online Kingdom은 상위권으로 인정받는 팀은 아니에요

translation.en: In fact, they were considered bottom four or just bottom eight for sure.
translation.ko: 그냥 하위 네 팀에서 여덟 팀 중 하나로 여기죠

translation.en: [Fear] This is our first time on LAN together.
The team together has only been around for around four-five months
translation.ko: 팀이 생긴 지 이제 한 4-5개월 됐나

translation.en: so it's a relatively new team.
And Pajkatt, our newest addition, playing Carry for us,
translation.ko: 우리 신입 Pajkatt이 캐리를 맡을 거예요

translation.en: he's only been on the team for three weeks now actually.
[Fear] We were really nervous going against a Chinese team
translation.ko: 중국 팀을 상대하는 게 굉장히 부담스러워요

translation.en: especially the top Chinese teams.
[James] There's gonna be players that choke
translation.ko: 어린 나이로 이런 압박감을 견뎌야 하기에

translation.en: handling this kind of pressure at such a young age.
translation.ko: 어린 나이로 이런 압박감을 견뎌야 하기에 그야말로 숨이 막히는 선수들도 있겠죠

translation.en: [Fear] 1437, like, this is the first time he's, like, ever been on LAN.
It's not easy, like, this is a million-dollar tournament.
translation.ko: 쉬운 일은 아니죠 백만 달러짜리 대회인데

translation.en: First time he's been on LAN.
[James] This stage. This prize money. This prestige. This is real competition.
translation.ko: 이런 무대, 상금, 명성 이런 게 진짜 대회죠

translation.en: [Fear] We tried to keep our cool together and we just played our game.
translation.ko: 저희는 그냥 침착하게 하던 대로 했어요

translation.en: [Dominik] We were super hyped.
Everyone was surprised we were doing so good.
Even we couldn't believe it.
[host] Online Kingdom dominating right now.
[Fear] After the match against TyLoo, everyone was very excited, you know.
translation.ko: TyLoo와 경기한 후에는 다들 엄청나게 흥분했어요

translation.en: We just beat one of the teams that were actually favored to win the competition.
So everyone's, like, spirits were like,
"Oh, we may be actually able to do this, you know."
Beating the Chinese teams, some people just, you know, for fun, they started,
translation.ko: 중국 팀을 이기고 나니까 사람들이 장난삼아 그러더라고요

translation.en: "Okay, hey, it's OK.Nirvana.Int. They're the China slayers."
[Liu] A few little bit surprises that we had yesterday. Quite a few upsets.
translation.ko: "둘째 날 더블 엘리미네이션 시작" 어제 놀라운 일이 몇 가지 있었죠 예기치 않은 승리였습니다

translation.en: OK.Nirvana.International managing to beat two Chinese teams in a row,
beating out TyLoo and OK.Nirvana.CN.
[Liu] They're currently on a roll now. And, um, Chinese teams are not unbeatable.
translation.ko: 승승장구하네요 중국 팀은 절대 못 꺾는 존재가 아니라는 거죠

translation.en: But, um, on the other hand,
EHOME are just proving that they are the strongest of the four Chinese teams
translation.ko: 3-0이라는 깔끔한 성적으로 중국 네 팀 중에서 가장 강력한 팀임을 입증해 보였습니다

translation.en: having a clean 3-0 record.
They are the favorites to win the whole tournament.
translation.ko: 이번 대회 우승 후보로 손꼽히는 팀이죠

translation.en: So they come in with the confidence
translation.ko: 벌써 여러 대회에서 우승한 팀이다 보니

translation.en: that they've won so many championships already.
[Liu] It's always a little bit of national pride at stake.
So, of course, they wanna prove that Chinese Dota is still a little bit above the rest.
translation.ko: 중국 '도타'가 아직 한 수 위란 걸 보여 주려 하겠죠

translation.en: [Liu] EHOME is one of the oldest Chinese Dota organizations.
translation.ko: EHOME은 가장 역사가 깊은 중국 '도타' 팀인데요

translation.en: They've always been at the top of competitive gaming.
translation.ko: 항상 대회에서 최고의 성적을 내 왔죠

translation.en: Most memorably at ESWC 2010.
[Pajkatt] Before ESWC 2010,
I thought, "Okay, the Chinese, they're probably pretty good, but like, how good can they be?"
translation.ko: '그래, 중국 팀이 잘한다지만 뭐 얼마나 잘하겠어?'

translation.en: [Pajkatt] And then we played EHOME who won that tournament without losing a single match.
translation.ko: 그런데 그 대회에서 EHOME은 무패로 완승해 버렸죠

translation.en: Like, they just crushed every team.
[Liu] EHOME finished the year as the best team in the history of Dota.
translation.ko: 그때 EHOME은 '도타' 역사상 최고 팀으로 한 해를 마무리했죠

translation.en: [Pajkatt] They were on a totally different level.
Like, they had their manager sitting behind them. He was making their calls.
translation.ko: 매니저가 뒤에 서서 작전을 짜고 지시를 했죠

translation.en: He was running around with this little black book.
translation.ko: 작은 수첩에 전부 적어서 이런저런 걸 처리했어요

translation.en: And they were the first team I heard of who did that.
translation.ko: 그렇게 한 건 그 팀이 처음이라고 들었어요

translation.en: [James] The EHOME manager copying down the draft, doing the prep work.
translation.ko: 선발 영웅을 기록하는 거나 준비 작업도 매니저가 했죠

translation.en: He was their coach.
There was a great interview that was done.
And it lined up all the top European captains who attended and the topic was EHOME.
translation.ko: 유럽 쪽 최고 캡틴들이 모여서 EHOME 얘기를 했어요

translation.en: If you want to ever play good, you don't need to invite Chinese teams
translation.ko: 좋은 성적을 내고 싶다면 중국 팀은 초대하지 마세요 너무 강하니까요

translation.en: -because they are too strong. -[laughter]
translation.ko: 중국 팀은 초대하지 마세요 너무 강하니까요

translation.en: [interviewer] So EHOME won, uh…
What do you think of, of the Chinese guys?
I never felt this outplayed in my entire life.
Uh, it's unbelievable how good they are. Like, their timing, their discipline…
translation.ko: 믿기지 않을 정도로 잘하네요 타이밍이나 연습 수준이…

translation.en: They're in control of the whole game, and they keep this control all the time.
translation.ko: 게임을 처음부터 끝까지 완벽히 지배하고 절대 긴장을 늦추지 않아요

translation.en: This is really crazy to see, actually.
[in Chinese] It's because when we are at any international tournament,
when all of the foreign team managers and team members see us,
translation.ko: 다른 나라 팀 감독이나 선수들이 저희를 보고

translation.en: everyone will all yell out, "EHOME!"
[in Chinese] Do you know how spectacular that is?
Actually, this is a story. It's a custom.
translation.ko: 사실 이런 게 일종의 전설이 되는 거죠

translation.en: [Tang, in Chinese] Which is when everyone sees EHOME,
they naturally think the king is entering.
[hyhy] During this trip to The International,
it's actually the same period as my exam periods.
So I treated it as a sacrifice that I've made… that I've made
for the team and for myself.
And I find that when it comes to pursuing your passions
it's really up to you to decide if it's worth, uh… worth the sacrifice.
When they're having exams, they don't allow him to leave the school
translation.ko: 시험 기간에는 학교에서 나가지 못하게 해요

translation.en: So I told him really I said, "Mind yourself."
[hyhy] Setting out on a career in gaming is risky. It's very risky.
translation.ko: 게이머가 된다는 것은 상당히 위험 부담이 커요

translation.en: Because the examinations actually clash with the competition
and missing the exams without a proper explanation,
translation.ko: 그리고 정당한 이유 없이 시험을 안 보겠다는 건데

translation.en: the school didn't recognize the Dota competition as a valid reason.
translation.ko: 학교에서는 '도타' 대회를 이유로 인정 안 해요

translation.en: [hyhy] It's kind of breaking school rules.
The school is determined to stop him from pursuing
his chance of going for this contest.
[Edwin] So I, I think this has created a big stress for the family.
translation.ko: 이 문제 때문에 온 가족이 스트레스를 많이 받아요

translation.en: Gives his mother very headache, you know?
[Vicky] It's quite difficult for us to pull him out right now, I think.
You know, he's so adamant about it.
So that's why when he told me he's going in August,
I said, "Then how about your school exams?
What are you going to do?"
[hyhy] I think my mother, she was kind of at her limits,
translation.ko: 제 생각에는 어머니께서 한계에 다다르셨나 봐요

translation.en: telling me about how much gaming has been weighing me down.
translation.ko: 제가 너무 게임에만 열중한다고 말씀하셨을 때

translation.en: That was really the talk when I really opened my heart, and I…
shared with her my passion for the game and how much I believed that.
translation.ko: 게임을 향한 제 열정과 확신을 말씀드렸죠

translation.en: [hyhy] My team actually has the potential to win, to be the best in the world.
translation.ko: 저희 팀은 우승해서 세계 최고가 될 거라고요

translation.en: So we are stopping at nothing less than first.
This is how I tried to put it across to my mom.
By giving up so much to come here
translation.ko: 여기까지 오느라 정말 많은 걸 포기했고

translation.en: I have absolute confidence in my team that we will win.
[host] All right, the draft is under way.
translation.ko: 자, 지금 양 팀에서 영웅을 선발합니다

translation.en: EHOME, they will select up their heroes. Scythe will start selecting theirs.
Looking now at both the teams, it looks like EHOME,
translation.ko: 현재 두 팀을 보면 EHOME은 꽤 여유로워 보이고

translation.en: they're fairly relaxed while Scythe, you know, they're eager.
translation.ko: EHOME은 꽤 여유로워 보이고 Scythe는 열의로 가득하네요

translation.en: They're all gathering around hyhy to pick.
translation.ko: 영웅 선발을 하려고 hyhy 주변에 모였어요

translation.en: [hyhy] If you have a losing draft, you will lose the game.
translation.ko: 영웅 선발에서 밀리면 게임을 이길 수 없죠

translation.en: This is what I think of Dota.
So it's really a lot on, on drafting.
[host] Drafting is where two captains will select what they want to play with.
translation.ko: 영웅 선발은 양 팀 캡틴이 플레이할 영웅을 결정하는 겁니다

translation.en: What heroes are selected and what heroes are taken out.
translation.ko: 어떤 영웅을 넣고 어떤 영웅을 뺄지를요

translation.en: You can select five heroes out of a pool of over a hundred,
translation.ko: 100여 명의 영웅 중에서 다섯을 선택할 수 있고

translation.en: and can also remove four of those heroes.
So four heroes you think your opponent will want to use, you can remove.
translation.ko: 상대 팀이 쓸 것 같은 영웅 넷을 미리 막는 겁니다

translation.en: [hyhy] Before any game, any match,
we will decide our bans and picks according to which team we are fighting.
translation.ko: 상대 팀에 따라 선택할 영웅과 금지할 영웅을 결정하죠

translation.en: Usually, we would come up with a very impromptu strategy
translation.ko: 저희는 거의 즉흥적으로 상대 팀 전략에 맞춰 경기하는 편이에요

translation.en: to try and fight their strat.
translation.ko: 상대 팀 전략에 맞춰 경기하는 편이에요

translation.en: You really have to spend a lot of time thinking of the draft.
translation.ko: 영웅 선발에 시간을 많이 투자해야 해요

translation.en: The draft actually decides a lot of the game itself.
[host] EHOME. They're a team with so much experience.
They already know the way they want to roll this one out.
translation.ko: 경기를 어떻게 풀어 나갈지 이미 알고 있습니다

translation.en: The only thing that's gonna make it or break it is if they can get their execution right.
translation.ko: 승패는 아는 그대로 플레이해 내느냐에 달린 거죠

translation.en: [hyhy] In that particular match-up, we felt that we needed something
translation.ko: 그 경기에서는 뭔가 좀 무섭게 보여야겠다고 느꼈어요

translation.en: that could instill the fear in them.
[host] And Tiny looks to be the last pick up here from Scythe.
A bit of an interesting pick up there by Scythe.
It's gonna start to change around their lanes completely now.
[host] With Tiny, it is good as a surprise strat.
If another team doesn't realize where he fits into the whole lineup,
translation.ko: 타이니를 왜 골랐는지 상대 팀에서 못 파악하면

translation.en: then you can really throw the opposition off balance.
[host] He's moving away, but no, hyhy,
he'll just turn around and pops the Lina.
I wanna point out right now that EHOME, they are not noobs.
translation.ko: 이 시점에서 분명히 말씀드리고 싶은 것은 EHOME은 초보 팀이 아니라는 점입니다

translation.en: This is just Scythe playing an amazing game.
[hyhy] When you have such a huge audience
and you know that everyone is at home watching the game,
they have their hopes pinned on you and, and I feel that…
there's so much at, at stake.
[host] And they should be able to clean it up right now.
translation.ko: 자, 이제 싹 쓸어 버릴 순간입니다

translation.en: Tiny, he's gonna toss, he's gonna launch, and he definitely gets the kill.
translation.ko: 던지기를 하려는 타이니 이건 확실히 잡겠네요

translation.en: We got 357 getting nailed out there.
Nature's Prophet gonna get the last hit in as well.
It's the entire team down for EHOME. This is GG.
-This is now a double-rax, at least. -[screams]
And EHOME, they're going to disconnect.
We have our first Winner's Bracket Finalist.
translation.ko: 이렇게 첫 승자조 진출 팀이 탄생합니다

translation.en: Scythe will advance.
EHOME will drop down into the Loser's Bracket,
and Scythe will now finish up this game.
Yeah, the one million is… Yeah, one million.
translation.ko: 네, 백만 달러… 그래요, 백만 달러는

translation.en: [chuckles] That's a lot.
It's gonna make my time playing this game all worth it.
translation.ko: 이제까지 게임에 쏟아부은 시간을 보상해 줄 거예요

translation.en: [hyhy] Didn't think smoking would do me any good.
[man] When did you start smoking?
Two years back.
Two years back, uh…
[clears throat] Bad move.
[man] That seems to coincide with when you and your ex-girlfriend broke up.
translation.ko: 전 여자 친구랑 헤어졌던 바로 그 시기네요

translation.en: [hyhy] On bad terms.
Seems like she's, she's moved on already.
Back then when she was playing the game it felt like we had something to… something we shared.
translation.ko: 전 여자 친구가 게임을 할 때는 공통점이 있었던 것 같은데

translation.en: Yeah, but right now, it's like… tsk.
I think she's… I think she's following this event, but… probably.
translation.ko: 이번 대회를 볼 것 같기는 해요

translation.en: This event's big. Yeah.
I hope I will get to make that phone call. Yeah.
Finally, I'll have something I'm proud of to tell her about.
translation.ko: 자랑스럽게 얘기할 거리가 드디어 생긴 거니까요

translation.en: Finally.
[James] When you played the Russians and the Ukrainians,
they were just the unpredictable teams.
I had no idea what the Russians were thinking.
translation.ko: 무슨 생각을 하는지 도무지 알 수가 없어요

translation.en: That was their best weapon.
translation.ko: 그게 러시아 팀의 가장 큰 무기죠

translation.en: [Dendi] Well, we're having fun. We're trying to relax.
We're trying to scare our opponents.
Mind games. Mind games. [chuckles]
[Dendi] I turn off my brain in the way of being scared of someone.
translation.ko: 누군가 두려워지면 그냥 생각을 멈춰 버려요

translation.en: One of the things I reallly admire about him is how…
he hasn't really had an easy life,
[Tammy] but he's always so upbeat. He's always so cheerful.
translation.ko: 항상 밝다는 점이에요 언제나 아주 쾌활해요

translation.en: [host] When he first came on the Dota scene, he looked like a 12-year-old boy.
translation.ko: 처음 '도타' 판에 나타났을 땐 그냥 12살 꼬맹이 같았어요

translation.en: Everyone was just, like, "Who is this kid?"
There's no way you can take this guy seriously. And then he would destroy you in games!
translation.ko: 별거 아닌 꼬맹이처럼 보였는데 그런 애한테 완전 발린 거죠

translation.en: [in Russian] I saw somewhere on the Internet,
how he works with the keyboard.
translation.ko: 그 애가 키보드 쓰는 걸 봤는데

translation.en: [Irina, in Russian] It really is mesmerizing.
[Irina, in Russian] I think Danil benefited from his piano playing
because his hands are absolutely amazing.
[Clement] He can make really good moves.
His moves, I think are unique, and they might win you the game.
translation.ko: 정말 독특한 수를 둬서 경기를 이기기도 하죠

translation.en: But he wants to rely completely on skill.
translation.ko: 그런데 Dendi는 오로지 실력으로 이기고 싶어 해요

translation.en: He wants, like, an enemy against him
and he wants to kill him through skill, nothing more.
translation.ko: 다른 거 없이 실력으로만 제압하고 싶어 하죠

translation.en: He wants to win the game.
His disadvantage is that he doesn't have patience.
He wants to make those moves.
[host] He can get a little bit too silly in games.
translation.ko: 게임 중에 좀 이상한 걸 하기도 해요

translation.en: He will try new and different things.
He will overextend in team fights because he believes he can get the kill.
translation.ko: 자기가 처치를 따낼 수 있다고 믿고 한타에서 무리를 해요

translation.en: [Clement] And his impatience can go too far and he might lose the game for us.
translation.ko: 섣불리 나서서 무리했다가 팀이 패배하기도 하죠

translation.en: -[teammate] Team Na'Vi! -[all] Team Na'Vi!
translation.ko: "Invictus Gaming 대 Na'Vi" 목표에만 집중하자! - Na'Vi 가자! - Na'Vi 가자!

translation.en: [Toby] There it is, he's gonna go in. This should be the First Blood.
They got the Sprout on Sansheng as well. There's probably gonna be a double.
Dendi's ulti, it hits!
Dendi, Dendi, no. He's not… he cannot be.
translation.ko: Dendi, 설마! 설마… 말도 안 돼요

translation.en: This is Dendi through and through.
Starts with the Hex, goes to Cold Snap, he locks him in place!
Weaver really close to death! Manages to Timelapse back out again.
translation.ko: 길쌈꾼은 죽기 일보 직전에 시간 거스르기로 탈출합니다!

translation.en: Dendi will TP back to safety.
So GG being called by iG. Na'Vi, they will take the game.
translation.ko: iG팀, GG를 선언하고 Na'Vi가 승리를 가져갑니다

translation.en: Our Winners Bracket Finalists are gonna be Na'Vi versus Scythe.
[Fear] Most teams that you see that have the most fan bases are full nationality.
translation.ko: 팬이 많은 팀은 대부분 같은 나라 선수들인데

translation.en: Our team is all spread out across the world.
translation.ko: 저희 팀 선수들은 세계 각국에서 모였죠

translation.en: [Tammy] He does have it a little harder than us
because he doesn't really have this human support that we do.
translation.ko: 인간적인 교감이 없을 테니 좀 더 힘들 거예요

translation.en: [Fear] The hardest thing that I've had to really deal with in my life
is just trying to convince my family about my gaming career.
It's really, really difficult especially when you start out slow,
translation.ko: 특히 늦게 시작하면 정말 정말 어렵죠

translation.en: but you know there's a future for something and you put a lot of time into it,
translation.ko: 미래가 있다는 것도 알고 많은 시간도 투자하는데

translation.en: and they keep telling you, "You should get a real job."
translation.ko: '진짜 취직을 해야 한다'는 얘기만 듣는 상황인 거죠

translation.en: [Fear] I was born in the Los Angeles district in Lancaster, California.
I lived there with my dad and my mom. Around two years old, my dad left my mom.
translation.ko: 거기서 부모님과 같이 살았죠 제가 두 살쯤 됐을 때 아버지가 떠나셨어요

translation.en: He didn't really say anything. He just kind of…
He just packed up and left.
[Fear] She's had to raise us both while going to law school at the same time.
translation.ko: 어머니 혼자 로스쿨을 다니시며 저희 둘을 키우셔야만 했죠

translation.en: It wasn't real easy as far as just got out of law school,
translation.ko: 정말 힘들었죠 로스쿨을 막 졸업한 상황에

translation.en: didn't have a job, had huge student loans to pay back.
translation.ko: 갚을 학자금 대출은 많고 직장도 없었으니까요

translation.en: [Karen] This job came up and so we moved here on our own.
So I've been raising them by myself ever since.
translation.ko: 그때부터 애 둘을 저 혼자 키우고 있는 거죠

translation.en: So this is a photo album that I made for Clinton.
For-- as he was growing up, I put pictures in it as we went along.
translation.ko: 살아가면서 자라는 모습을 사진으로 여기에 모았죠

translation.en: My sons were both really active into sports
translation.ko: 두 아들 다 운동에 엄청 적극적이고

translation.en: and they wanted to do a lot so I had to limit them.
translation.ko: 하고 싶은 게 너무 많아서 시즌마다 두 종목씩만 고르도록 제한했죠

translation.en: They could choose two per season.
[Karen] That was maximum for me being able to get them to practice
translation.ko: 제가 연습에 데려가거나 경기를 보러 가는 건

translation.en: and go watch their games. That was tough.
translation.ko: 딱 두 종목이 한계였어요 사실 그것도 힘들었죠

translation.en: And Clinton sitting on Santa's lap, his brother, "Santa."
translation.ko: 클린턴이 무릎에 앉은 이 산타가 형이에요

translation.en: [Fear] My brother's more angry at my father for leaving than I am.
translation.ko: 형은 떠난 아버지를 저보다 훨씬 더 미워해요

translation.en: He thinks about him, he gets upset.
Compared to me, I just… I just block him out and pretend he doesn't exist.
translation.ko: 전 그냥 떠올리지도 않고 없는 사람으로 여겨요

translation.en: [Karen] Ah, Clinton already starting, uh, video games here.
[Tony] He was sitting at his house, playing Dota.
Doing it competitively. Had a sponsored team and everything like that.
translation.ko: 후원받는 팀에 들어가고 대회에 나가서 경기도 했죠

translation.en: Uh, but I think that's when it probably started getting on his… his mom's nerves.
translation.ko: 어머님 신경에 거슬린 게 아마 그때쯤일 거예요

translation.en: [Fear] I have a crazy sleeping schedule.
I'm on a European team, so sometimes I have to stay up pretty ridiculous hours
translation.ko: 유럽 팀에 속해 있으니 말도 안 되게 늦게 자고 이상한 때 일어났죠

translation.en: or wake up at ridiculous hours.
translation.ko: 말도 안 되게 늦게 자고 이상한 때 일어났죠

translation.en: So the standard day for me is not so standard.
All the nights he'd be up and stuff, the dog would be up too with him
translation.ko: 클린턴이 밤을 새우면 개도 같이 깨어 있고

translation.en: and that would keep her awake most of the nights
translation.ko: 그러면 보통 어머니도 잠을 못 주무셨어요

translation.en: and this is kind of where the tension got pretty high.
[Karen] You know, this, this went on for years
and it came to the point where I just told him
I said, "You know what, you just need to go somewhere else."
translation.ko: '이제 독립해서 나갈 때가 된 것 같구나'

translation.en: [Fear] So I got kicked out of my house because of my gaming career, basically.
[Pete] When Clinton first moved in here,
he was looking for a desk and there wasn't anything in the room.
And I had a lot of stuff that we were getting ready to take to the dump.
[Pete] And Clinton went out there and he came back in with this green desk.
translation.ko: 클린턴이 나가 보더니 이 초록색 책상을 들고 왔어요

translation.en: And he goes, "This is perfect!"
So I didn't have a monitor, so I went to my friend
translation.ko: 전 모니터도 없었어요 그래서 CRT 모니터가 하나 남는 친구에게

translation.en: and he had a spare CRT monitor.
translation.ko: 그래서 CRT 모니터가 하나 남는 친구에게

translation.en: So I got that, and then, obviously, I have two books here to hunch that up
translation.ko: 모니터를 받아서 책 두 권 받치고

translation.en: so I can actually see the monitor, so it's kind of a ghetto setup.
translation.ko: 눈높이를 맞춰 놓고 써요 빈민가 세팅인 셈이죠

translation.en: Even when I go to competitions, I don't think I play like any differently on the nice setups compared to this one.
translation.ko: 사실 대회에서 좋은 장비를 써도 여기서 할 때와 똑같아요

translation.en: Clinton's like, uh, the Rocky Balboa of Dota.
He's the… he's definitely one of the first big US players.
[Tony] And, honestly, I didn't even, even know he was that big.
translation.ko: 사실 전 그 정도로 유명한지도 몰랐어요

translation.en: [Theeban] In the North American scene, there weren't many good American players known back then.
translation.ko: 그때 북미에는 그렇게 잘하는 선수가 많지 않았거든요

translation.en: Everybody respected Fear.
[Fear] A lot of the people I knew, they quit the game.
translation.ko: 제가 알던 사람 중 여럿이 게임을 그만뒀어요

translation.en: They moved on, stuff like that.
But I stuck with it so I ended up being like one of the oldest players.
translation.ko: 하지만 전 남아서 계속했고 이젠 최고령 게이머가 되었죠

translation.en: [Troels] With all his years of experience
and all his constant commitment to the game,
he's really shown that he doesn't give up.
translation.ko: 포기하지 않는다는 걸 제대로 보여 줬죠

translation.en: [Fear] Growing up without my father, I think in the end, like…
translation.ko: 아버지가 안 계셔서 남자 대 남자로 뭘 배우거나

translation.en: not having someone there to teach me of the guy side
and having a father to help you up,
I think that it's actually probably made me, like, the person I am today.
translation.ko: 결국 아버지가 안 계신 덕에 지금의 제가 된 셈이죠

translation.en: You know, I just make sure everything's running smoothly on the team.
translation.ko: 전 팀이 별 탈 없이 잘 돌아가게 하려고 해요

translation.en: I kind of play, like, the father figure, I guess.
[Jimmy] As a captain, I guess he felt he had that responsibility as well.
translation.ko: 캡틴이니까 그런 책임을 느끼는 것 같아요

translation.en: He was like pretty much my mentor.
He did tell me one time,
"Hey, if you need someone to talk to," you know, he would be here.
So I kind of see him as a Dota brother.
I've never had an ego, like, thinking that I'm better than anyone else.
translation.ko: 전 제가 다른 사람보다 낫다고 생각한 적이 없어요

translation.en: I'm always there willing to help people who are new to the scene.
translation.ko: 누군가 '도타' 판에 들어오면 기꺼이 도와주고 싶어요

translation.en: [Fear] And that's always been kind of my role in the game,
translation.ko: 그게 게임 내에서 제 역할이기도 하죠

translation.en: by just helping players get up, for the most part.
[Theeban] Fear actually broke me into the scene, you know.
translation.ko: Fear 덕분에 이 판에 들어올 수 있었어요

translation.en: It's very hard to get yourself out there.
I mean, back then, I was kind of like a fanboy of him.
translation.ko: 예전에는 그냥 Fear의 경기를 보며 응원하는

translation.en: You know, watching his games and whatnot.
[Theeban] And he gave me a shot to play at a high level.
translation.ko: 높은 수준의 게임을 해 볼 기회를 줬죠

translation.en: I wouldn't be here today if it wasn't for Fear.
I can guarantee you that.
[Theeban] Going into the match, we were all thinking,
MUFC didn't do so well earlier, but…
If we lost that game, we wouldn't win anything, so…
translation.ko: 어쨌든 그 경기를 지면 모두 잃을 판이라

translation.en: it was a high-risk game.
[Toby] Thirty-six minutes in, almost a 7,000 gold advantage in favor of MUFC.
translation.ko: 36분 정도 지난 지금 MUFC가 7천 골드 정도 앞서 있네요

translation.en: [Fear] Toward the end, we made a couple of mistakes that put two heroes on the sideline for us.
translation.ko: 경기가 끝날 때쯤 실수로 우리 편 둘을 잃었어요

translation.en: And they had all five still up and decided that they were gonna go for our Throne.
translation.ko: 상대는 다섯 명 다 살아서 저희 요새를 치러 오고 있었죠

translation.en: -They're probably gonna push for the base. -They're going GG!
translation.ko: - 그냥 기지로 밀고 오려나 봅니다 - GG인가요!

translation.en: -They want to go for the GG! -No Fortification!
translation.ko: - GG를 받아 내려는 것 같네요! - 이제 강화도 안 됩니다!

translation.en: [Theeban] We were really close to losing our Throne. It's below 20 percent HP.
translation.ko: 요새를 잃기 직전이었어요 체력이 20%도 안 남았죠

translation.en: [Toby] And Online Kingdom, they are so close to the point of getting eliminated from this tournament!
We just needed to do something.
I'm going to go on them! I'm going to initiate on them!
[Fear] I ran in first and then they all went on me
translation.ko: 제가 뛰어들어 가니까 다행히 전부 요새를 치는 대신 절 잡으러 왔어요

translation.en: instead of focusing on the Throne, which is good.
translation.ko: 다행히 전부 요새를 치는 대신 절 잡으러 왔어요

translation.en: [Toby] Again by Silvercross.
Fear, he's trying to retreat. He turned into a pig.
How the hell is he still alive?
Go, go, go! Go, go!
[Toby] They push MUFC back!
We made this huge comeback where we killed all of their heroes.
translation.ko: 상대 영웅을 다 처치하고 다시 재정비했어요

translation.en: [Theeban] You know, started pushing.
[Toby] Silvercross is down! Morphling! He's out of this!
The Top Rax will go!
There is no way now that MUFC can come back!
It will be Online Kingdom eliminating MUFC!
What an incredible…
Our whole team just went crazy.
[Toby] Fear leading Online Kingdom to do the impossible.
translation.ko: Fear가 Online Kingdom을 이끌어 불가능을 가능하게 했습니다

translation.en: I've never seen anything like that.
And stay tuned.
We'll be back here for more exciting gameplay coming up.
[Dendi] Scythe. They are the 2008 ESWC winners.
One of the best Asian teams but we aren't afraid of them.
translation.ko: 아시아 최고 중 하나지만 두렵진 않습니다

translation.en: We're gonna fight them.
I don't know about my teammates, but I don't feel scared at all.
translation.ko: 팀원들은 어떨지 모르지만 전 전혀 겁먹지 않았어요

translation.en: I feel like I want to crush my enemy.
translation.ko: 그저 적을 뭉개 버리고 싶단 생각뿐이에요

translation.en: That's how I feel. That's it.
[Toby] Welcome to the Winners Bracket Final
where Scythe goes up against Na'Vi.
The winner gets a slot in the Grand Final.
[hyhy] The crowds were all cheering for them.
translation.ko: 관객들이 전부 상대 팀 Na'Vi를 응원했어요

translation.en: And their draft was very scary. We were, like, caught off by surprise.
translation.ko: 고른 영웅도 무시무시했고요 놀라서 멍해졌다고나 할까

translation.en: But, we were like, "We've gotta win this, man."
We've gotta show them who's boss.
[Toby] Scythe has managed to take all the best players from Singapore
and put them in their lineup.
One million!
[Toby] Na'Vi, they look cool, calm, and collected.
They know exactly what they gotta do.
It all comes down to gameplay right now.
And I gotta say like, Na'Vi's lineup, it is not unbeatable.
So now they're gonna look for the initiation and possible kill.
translation.ko: "Na'Vi가 초반부터 Scythe를 공격적으로 몰아붙인다" 처치할 기회를 노리며 교전을 시작합니다

translation.en: hy is gonna get caught.
Now bottom lane. Held in place.
Sven stunned. Sven will go down.
LighTofHeaveN, he helped out, but Ancient Apparition gets the last hit.
translation.ko: LighTofHeaveN이 돕는 와중에 막타는 고대 영혼이 때립니다

translation.en: [Toby] Na'Vi are dominating this final.
translation.ko: Na'Vi가 승자조 결승전을 완전히 장악해 나갑니다

translation.en: Now Na'Vi, they're gonna take the chance here.
They're gonna go in for the GG.
And GG is the call from hy first.
Na'Vi are already off their computers.
They're not even sticking around. They've got the GG.
Na'Vi are into the Grand Finals and will play for the one million dollars.
translation.ko: Na'Vi가 최종 결승전에 진출 백만 달러를 노립니다

translation.en: Scythe will go down.
They will face the winner of the Loser's Bracket.
translation.ko: Scythe는 이제 패자조의 우승팀과 겨룹니다 "한 번만 더 패하면 Scythe는 이 대회에서 탈락한다"

translation.en: [hyhy] We had just lost our confidence match against Na'Vi.
It was actually quite a blow to us.
The game was really the turning point for me
translation.ko: 그 게임은 제 인생을 완전히 바꿨어요

translation.en: because I actually learned that in life you can only trust in yourself, actually…
translation.ko: 정말 살면서 믿을 건 자신뿐임을 배웠죠

translation.en: not in the sense that you can't trust people,
translation.ko: 다른 사람은 믿을 수 없다는 얘기가 아니라

translation.en: but, yeah, like I said, the one who will never let you down is yourself.
translation.ko: 자신의 기대를 저버리지 않는 건 자기 자신뿐이라는 뜻이에요

translation.en: [Fear] Within the gaming world, I'd like to be, be the first place.
You know, it's like I'm following behind my mother's footsteps, basically.
translation.ko: 어머니가 가셨던 길을 그대로 밟는 셈이죠

translation.en: She worked really hard to get where she is,
translation.ko: 정말 열심히 노력해서 현재의 자리에 오르셨거든요

translation.en: and I kind of wanna be the same way. I wanna work hard for whatever I do.
translation.ko: 저도 그렇게 무엇이든 열심히 하고 싶어요

translation.en: [Fear] For me, I mean, I've never really had a dad.
translation.ko: 사실 제 삶엔 아버지라는 존재가 있던 적이 없어서

translation.en: So if I had any questions about anything,
the person I was most comfortable talking to was my mom.
[Fear] She definitely had the most influence on my life.
translation.ko: 제 삶에 가장 큰 영향을 끼친 사람이시죠

translation.en: When she comes home from work,
she's always, you know, anxious to bring up the subject how she won a big case.
translation.ko: 큰 사건에서 어떻게 승소했는지 굉장히 얘기하고 싶어 하시죠

translation.en: I'm always proud of her when she wins these big cases
'cause I know it means a lot to her.
[Fear] In the back of my head, I'm always, like,
if I do well and if I win this tournament, you know,
I'll finally be able to prove, like, I'm getting something out of this.
translation.ko: 드디어 무언가 해낼 수 있음을 증명할 수 있겠다고 생각하죠

translation.en: [Toby] And whoever wins this match will be facing up against EHOME,
translation.ko: "Online Kingdom 탈락 위기에 놓이다" 이번 경기에서 승리하는 팀이 EHOME과 만나 싸웁니다

translation.en: but whoever will lose it, is going to be eliminated already.
Like, EHOME, they're looking really strong right now.
[Fear] We had the stronger late-game heroes, the better team fight.
Just all we had to do was just control the pushes.
translation.ko: 그냥 미는 상황을 잘 운용하면 돼요

translation.en: [Toby] Now, Online Kingdom, they're split! The stun on Santa! The splash as well.
translation.ko: Online Kingdom이 두 곳을 동시에 밉니다! Santa 선수에게 기절 공격! 범위 피해도 들어갔네요

translation.en: They're gonna claim a Windrunner. Will they? Yes, they do!
It's 2-0 for Online Kingdom. Moscow 5, not the start they wanted.
translation.ko: Online Kingdom이 2대0으로 앞섭니다 Moscow 5가 원했던 시작은 아니었습니다

translation.en: But Online Kingdom having an amazing start…
translation.ko: Online Kingdom 팀의 시작이 아주 좋습니다

translation.en: We were so close to winning until some few mistakes that occurred in the late game.
translation.ko: 거의 다 이긴 경기였는데 후반에 실수가 좀 있었죠

translation.en: [Toby] They might go right now.
There's four heroes standing right next to each other. The timing is wrong!
translation.ko: 네 명이 나란히 서 있네요 타이밍이 맞지 않았어요!

translation.en: [Fear] There's communication problems because we're an international team.
translation.ko: 아무래도 다국적 팀이라 의사소통에 문제가 있어요

translation.en: So I think full-nationality teams have an advantage over most teams.
translation.ko: 단일 국적 팀이 보통 더 유리하죠

translation.en: [Toby] Almost there! Big try! Fear's in trouble though.
translation.ko: 거의 다 됐습니다! 큰 모험을 하네요! Fear 선수, 위험한데요

translation.en: He's shackled and Lacoste is in. He casts his ulti as well.
translation.ko: 올가미에 걸렸네요 Lacoste 들어갑니다 궁극기도 씁니다

translation.en: [Theeban] And it just fell apart from there.
They just slowly beat us down.
Eventually, they just broke our base and took every single one of our raxes.
translation.ko: 결국 기지로 밀고 들어와 병영을 모조리 파괴했죠

translation.en: [Toby] This is really hurting Online Kingdom.
They've lost three. Enigma pops.
The team is wiped for Online Kingdom.
The base will be taken and Moscow 5 will now play EHOME and advance in the tournament.
translation.ko: 요새가 파괴되었고 Moscow 5가 다음 경기에서 EHOME을 상대합니다

translation.en: Now, Online Kingdom, they are out. So much promise.
It didn't happen in the end for Fear and the rest of Online Kingdom,
translation.ko: Fear와 다른 팀원들이 바라던 결과는 나오지 않았죠 "Online Kingdom 탈락 상금 2만 5천 달러 획득"

translation.en: and it will be Moscow 5 that will advance…
translation.ko: 다음 라운드에 올라가는 건 바로 Moscow 5 팀입니다

translation.en: [Theeban] I think everybody on the team was very emotional.
translation.ko: 팀원들 모두 굉장히 울컥했던 것 같아요

translation.en: I could only imagine how he was feeling.
translation.ko: Fear가 어떤 기분일지는 짐작만 할 수밖에요

translation.en: [Dominik] Some people take it more personally and they give everything to win.
translation.ko: 몇몇은 더 기분이 안 좋았죠 우승에 모든 걸 걸었거든요

translation.en: [Theeban] It was very satisfying knowing that we reached that Top 8,
translation.ko: 저희가 상위 8팀이라는 사실이 확인돼서 아주 만족스러워요

translation.en: but he had better expectations for our team,
translation.ko: 하지만 Fear 선수는 더 많이 기대했었죠

translation.en: and we'd come a long way and it's all thanks to Fear.
translation.ko: 그래도 꽤 많이 갔어요 전부 Fear 덕분이었죠

translation.en: [Dominik] If you don't go as far as you thought you were gonna be,
I guess you end up in tears or something.
[Fear] All of us are really disappointed, but I guess that's just how it goes.
translation.ko: 모두 정말 실망했지만… 어쩔 수 없죠

translation.en: When I get back home, I need to make a big decision in my life.
translation.ko: 집에 돌아가면 중요한 결정을 내려야 해요

translation.en: Like, just the benefits of playing Dota professionally,
how much I can make from it,
and how much time I really need to put into it to be 100 percent, so…
[Fear] The only way I would ever do that is if I move in with my teammates
translation.ko: 그런 결과를 내려면 팀 숙소를 마련해서 팀원과 합숙하는 게 답이에요

translation.en: and have like a training house with them,
translation.ko: 팀 숙소를 마련해서 팀원과 합숙하는 게 답이에요

translation.en: so I know for sure that we're all dedicated.
I think things happen for a reason,
translation.ko: 일어나는 모든 일에는 다 이유가 있다고 생각해요

translation.en: and when things happen, you just do your best
and continue going forward with it.
I mean, deep down inside, I know this career is gonna work out for me in the end.
translation.ko: 마음 깊은 곳에선 결국 이 일이 잘 풀릴 거라는 걸 알아요

translation.en: [analyst, in Chinese] As for the Chinese teams, I hope and know
translation.ko: 중국 팀이 패자조에서 반드시 올라오리라 생각합니다

translation.en: that they're capable of coming out of the Losers Bracket.
translation.ko: 중국 팀이 패자조에서 반드시 올라오리라 생각합니다 아마 상위 3팀은

translation.en: The top three teams are likely to be Na'Vi, Scythe, and a Chinese team
translation.ko: 아마 상위 3팀은 Na'Vi랑 Scythe에 중국 팀 하나가 될 것 같습니다

translation.en: which I personally hope will be EHOME.
translation.ko: Na'Vi랑 Scythe에 중국 팀 하나가 될 것 같습니다 EHOME이었으면 좋겠네요

translation.en: [woman analyst, in Chinese] Emotionally, I would hope that EHOME would win.
Turning him into a pig! They need to get this kill.
translation.ko: 돼지로 변신시켰습니다! 여기서 처치를 따내야 하는데요

translation.en: The stun! The Weaver Wave! It's a little piglet!
translation.ko: 기절! 길쌈꾼이 몰아칩니다! 새끼 돼지를 잡았습니다!

translation.en: And it's dead! Slardar! 820, he's almost dead!
Burrow Strike! Epicenter!
357! It's a double-kill by the Weaver!
EHOME, they'll lose FCB as well.
Moscow 5, casualties of war.
Holy Hell!
[Zou, in Chinese] In China, this game is a professional career.
We are stressed because we have to win.
If we don't win or we lose to foreign teams,
[Zou, in Chinese] Chinese fans will have doubt in us.
[Toby] Now Lion though is gonna find him. Boxes him up.
Finger's already started. There's the stun.
Maelk in a lot of trouble. Really caught out of position.
AA ulti will fly in but hits on nothing. Mania with the SK ultimate…
translation.ko: 고대 영혼, 궁극기를 날리지만 맞히지 못합니다 Mania는 모래 제왕 궁극기로…

translation.en: [Tang, in Chinese] The situation is China against the world.
If we win the championship, it is what we are supposed to do.
translation.ko: 이 대회에서 우승하는 것이 저희가 해야 할 일이에요

translation.en: I tell them, if you are coming here, you are here for the first place.
translation.ko: 선수들에게 여기 온 이상 우승해야 한다고 말하죠

translation.en: I will tell them every day, we must accomplish this. We must achieve this.
translation.ko: 선수들에게 여기 온 이상 우승해야 한다고 말하죠 '이겨야 해, 우승해야 해'라고 매일 말해 줄 생각입니다

translation.en: Our tradition is anything other than the champion trophy we will not bring home.
translation.ko: 저희 전통은 우승 트로피 아니면 안 가져가는 거예요

translation.en: They will go ahead and trash it at the airport.
translation.ko: 우승 트로피 아니면 안 가져가는 거예요 다른 건 공항에서 버리죠

translation.en: [Toby] Now PLT. Support Teleporting in. FCB gets the first stun.
translation.ko: PLT를 도우러 순간이동합니다 먼저 FCB가 기절시킵니다

translation.en: Misery over-commits on the top lane.
-[shouts] -GG!
[Tang, in Chinese] I can feel they really want to beat us, the foreign teams.
translation.ko: 해외 팀들은 저희를 정말 이기고 싶은가 봐요

translation.en: PLT, he's had enough of this. FCB! What a time for a Frog!
translation.ko: PLT, 이제 못 참죠 FCB! 개구리 만들기 딱 좋은 시간입니다!

translation.en: Misery will pop!
[in Chinese] But when they watch us play, they feel…
translation.ko: 하지만 저희 하는 걸 보면 그들도 느끼죠

translation.en: that there is no way to beat us.
[hyhy] This is where my dad works.
For as long as I remember,
he's doing the logistics for the company here.
translation.ko: 이 회사 물류 쪽 일을 하세요

translation.en: So it involves the shipping of the containers from one place to another.
translation.ko: 그러다 보면 컨테이너를 나르는 일도 하셔야 하고요

translation.en: [hyhy] When I was younger, he used to work, like, 15 to 16 hours a day.
translation.ko: 제가 어릴 때 아버지는 하루에 15-16시간씩 일하셨어요

translation.en: He's pretty much given up on everything else in his life.
translation.ko: 일 말고 다른 삶은 다 포기하셨죠

translation.en: He's always made it clear to me that, you know, I should focus on my life,
focus on my studies so as to not follow in his footsteps.
translation.ko: 인생과 공부에 집중하라고 분명하게 말씀하셨어요 당신과 같은 전철을 밟지 않게 하시려고요

translation.en: He doesn't want me to, you know, be slogging as hard as he is right now.
translation.ko: 똑같이 고된 일을 하지 않기를 바라시는 거죠

translation.en: [hyhy] But, you know, the chance to be the best in the world at, at something…
translation.ko: 하지만 한 분야에서 세계 최고가 될 기회는

translation.en: you don't get it much in life.
I heard my son say, uh, he's working at this, what, Dota.
translation.ko: 제 아들이… 뭐라더라 '도타'라나 뭐, 그런 걸 한대요

translation.en: [Lim] He spends a lot of time and he gets nothing. For me, it's very disappointing.
translation.ko: 시간은 엄청나게 들이는데 얻는 게 없으니 실망스럽죠

translation.en: Never goes to school. He wants to play computer.
Then in the morning, sleep. [Lim] Then computer until the next day morning. Then he sleeps.
translation.ko: 아침에 잠들었다가 다시 밤새 컴퓨터 하다 자고

translation.en: The whole day at least 15 hours at the computer a day.
His life, my… [chuckles] …my son's life is like that.
For me, I hope for my son to study more. Not like me. I never studied.
translation.ko: 공부를 더 했으면 좋겠어요 전 공부를 안 했거든요

translation.en: When I was young, I was also the same as Han Yong, always spent a lot of time to play.
translation.ko: 저도 한용이처럼 어렸을 땐 놀기만 했죠

translation.en: [Lim] But now I also regret, why I don't study.
translation.ko: 지금에 와서 왜 공부를 안 했나 후회가 돼요

translation.en: But now I'm hoping my son continues to study
to get an education better than me.
This is my hope.
I want to win this badly.
Are you ready for EHOME?
We'll do whatever we can.
translation.ko: 할 수 있는 건 뭐든지 할 거예요

translation.en: For hy, I feel it was a great choice, a brilliant choice.
translation.ko: hyhy에겐 좋은 선택이고 훌륭한 선택이라고 생각해요

translation.en: Because he was considering that we could have won.
It's an opportunity that you shouldn't miss out.
So, get ready, sign in, log in, play around, test a little bit,
and then join the lobby in about four minutes.
[Daryl] It's a once-in-a-lifetime chance.
If you miss it, it might be gone forever. You might not experience it again.
translation.ko: 한번 놓치면 끝이죠 평생 다시 안 올지도 몰라요

translation.en: [Toby] And we have a rematch. EHOME versus Scythe.
translation.ko: 두 팀이 다시 만났습니다 EHOME 대 Scythe

translation.en: EHOME facing up against the team that forced them into the lower bracket.
translation.ko: EHOME은 자기네를 패자조로 밀어낸 팀과 다시 경기하네요

translation.en: [Liu] The psychological pressure is immense, especially upon the drafter.
translation.ko: 심리적 부담이 어마어마하죠 영웅을 고르는 선수는 더요

translation.en: Because he is the one who is in the end responsible for the team's picks.
translation.ko: 결국 팀원의 영웅까지도 전부 책임지는 거잖아요

translation.en: -No, no, no, no, no. -No, no. Don't say no!
No, no. Trust me. No.
Wait, wait, wait. Tell me this. You really want it?
translation.ko: 잠깐, 잠깐만 얘기해 봐, 정말 원해?

translation.en: I really think…
It's the Antimage and SF. That's what I think.
translation.ko: 항마사랑 그림자 마귀 그게 내 생각이야

translation.en: [Toby] Shadow Fiend? Alrighty then. It's hyhy as SF.
translation.ko: 그림자 마귀인가요? 그렇군요 hyhy가 그림자 마귀입니다

translation.en: Everyone knows how to counter a Shadow Fiend.
translation.ko: 그림자 마귀 대처법은 이미 다 알려졌죠

translation.en: It's a very bold pickup here by Scythe.
The fact, if Scythe wins the early game, they're gonna gain so much momentum,
translation.ko: 사실 Scythe가 초반에 잘하면 굉장히 탄력을 받을 겁니다

translation.en: but if they don't, then EHOME will basically roll themselves into the Grand Final.
translation.ko: 하지만 그렇게 못 하면 EHOME이 결승전에 진출하겠죠

translation.en: hyhy, BKB is gonna wear off pretty soon, Venomancer, great strike!
translation.ko: hyhy, 칠흑왕의 지팡이 효과가 곧 사라집니다 맹독사의 한 방!

translation.en: -[Toby] hy's dead! -Stay in the trees now!
And he wants xy-, he catches up to him. And he brings him down.
[in Chinese] Hey! I told you to stay in the trees!
Why'd you come out?
-Stay in the trees! I told you. -What will I do?
translation.ko: - 나무 사이에 있으라고 했잖아! - 나보고 어쩌라고? 궁극기 제대로 들어갔어요! 강화 톱니도 썼습니다!

translation.en: [Toby] What an ulti! He Cogs!
translation.ko: 궁극기 제대로 들어갔어요! 강화 톱니도 썼습니다!

translation.en: Chawy, he wants to leap, but there is just no Mana!
[in Chinese] I already told you.
-I told you. Do you understand? -It's okay. I'm alive. I'm alive.
[Toby] If he can pop off an ulti like that, he doesn't really have to reveal himself to his opponent.
translation.ko: 저렇게 궁극기를 써서 상대편에게 들키지 않고

translation.en: He can really just initiate. Oh, there he goes!
translation.ko: 전투를 시작할 수 있죠 들어갑니다! hyhy, 궁극기를 못 썼어요

translation.en: hyhy doesn't manage to pop off an ultimate.
translation.ko: 들어갑니다! hyhy, 궁극기를 못 썼어요 - 좋아! - 지진술사는 이미 죽었죠

translation.en: -[Toby] Earthshaker is already dead. -Nice!
translation.ko: - 좋아! - 지진술사는 이미 죽었죠 - 좋아! - A2RS가 hyhy 저격수예요

translation.en: [Toby] A2RS really gunning for hyhy.
There are already three gone. Make that four.
It's a double-kill for the Anti-mage. And they're headed for the tower right now.
There is a GG. Good Game called by hyhy.
Scythe have had enough now. EHOME will advance.
The Chinese hopes will stay alive
translation.ko: 한 게임 불리한 상태로 Na'Vi와 맞서지만

translation.en: as they will go up against Na'Vi with a one-game disadvantage…
translation.ko: 중국의 희망은 아직 사라지지 않았습니다 "Scythe 탈락 상금 15만 달러 획득"

translation.en: [hyhy] The first-placing was very important to me.
And to add on to that, my studies were also at the same time affected by everything.
So everything was related.
When everything comes falling down at the same time
it's quite hard to handle.
[hyhy] Things are all changed.
So you gotta, like, plan your life again. All over again.
translation.ko: 인생을 다시 계획해야 해요 처음부터 전부 다시요

translation.en: I've learned a lot.
You've gotta realize your, your flaws.
That's the toughest part, I feel.
I don't do things as well alone.
So if you try to do everything by yourself,
translation.ko: 혼자 모든 일을 다 하는 건

translation.en: it's not gonna be possible, you know.
I'm actually a believer of fate, and I told myself
translation.ko: 사실 운명을 믿는 편인데 저 자신에겐 우승까지는 필요 없다고 말했어요

translation.en: that, um, winning isn't necessary
translation.ko: 저 자신에겐 우승까지는 필요 없다고 말했어요

translation.en: because there are so many more things in life.
translation.ko: 인생엔 더 중요한 것들이 훨씬 더 많으니까요

translation.en: How you take care of the people you love.
I think that's, that's a very big thing. You know that's a very important thing.
translation.ko: 그게 가장 큰 일이죠 아주 중요한 일이고

translation.en: It's, it's the most important thing ever.
[Dendi] Catch these guys.
It's not fair. Catch these guys.
I just woke up. It's not fair.
translation.ko: 전 이제 일어났는데 이러는 게 어딨어요

translation.en: [Dendi] My haircut… still crazy. No?
But I don't care.
Okay, I have everything with me.
Let's go.
[Toby] We are now at the final day of The International Dota 2 Championships.
translation.ko: The International '도타 2' 대회가 펼쳐지는 마지막 날입니다

translation.en: It is Na'Vi. They have a one-game advantage.
translation.ko: Na'Vi 팀입니다 1승 앞선 아주 좋은 조건에서 결승전을 시작합니다

translation.en: Sitting very, very sweetly in the Grand Final.
translation.ko: 1승 앞선 아주 좋은 조건에서 결승전을 시작합니다

translation.en: Who will get a shot at the one million dollars?
[Liu] Na'Vi was running the same strategy the whole time
translation.ko: Na'Vi는 쭉 같은 전략을 써 왔는데

translation.en: and no one seemed to be able to counter it.
Na'Vi loves pushing from minute 10 and trying to end the game at minute 15.
[Fear] Those strategies are very sensitive because if you fail even once
translation.ko: 그런 전략은 세심하게 할 수밖에 없죠 한 번이라도 잘못되면 경기가 급격히 힘들어지니까요

translation.en: it can become a very difficult game for you.
translation.ko: 한 번이라도 잘못되면 경기가 급격히 힘들어지니까요

translation.en: EHOME has been known for how well they defend their base
translation.ko: EHOME은 기지 방어가 좋기로 소문이 나 있죠

translation.en: So if there was a team that could stop Na'Vi's push it would be EHOME.
translation.ko: Na'Vi를 저지할 팀이 있다면 바로 EHOME일 겁니다

translation.en: [Toby] And let's get this game underway.
The players will start to pick up their heroes with one million dollars at stake.
translation.ko: 각 팀, 백만 달러가 걸린 영웅 선택을 합니다

translation.en: Na'Vi will need to win two. EHOME will need to win three.
translation.ko: Na'Vi는 두 번 EHOME은 세 번 이겨야 합니다

translation.en: [Liu] Running a very, very old school strategy with three core heroes.
translation.ko: 핵심 영웅 셋으로 아주 전통적인 전략을 펼칩니다

translation.en: EHOME managed to survive Na'Vi's onslaught early.
translation.ko: 초반에 Na'Vi의 학살을 EHOME이 겨우 버텨 냈죠

translation.en: [Toby] It's all on Dendi. PLT TP's himself in.
translation.ko: 전부 Dendi를 노립니다 PLT도 순간이동으로 왔습니다 Dendi가 포탑으로 후퇴합니다

translation.en: Dendi on the retreat back out to the tower.
translation.ko: PLT도 순간이동으로 왔습니다 Dendi가 포탑으로 후퇴합니다

translation.en: Will he get himself away? X!!. There it is.
Last hit, 357, the Venomancer brings down Dendi in the middle.
translation.ko: 맹독사 357의 마지막 타격으로 Dendi가 가운데서 쓰러집니다

translation.en: [Fear] Every time you see Dendi perform he's always playing very well
translation.ko: 보통 Dendi가 하는 걸 보면 항상 뛰어난 플레이를 펼치죠

translation.en: and he usually doesn't lose his lanes.
[Clement] So, Dendi, his impatience is that Chinese teams, they are patient.
translation.ko: Dendi가 또 성급했어요 중국 팀은 진득하죠

translation.en: They look out for the fact that you might cross a line,
translation.ko: 상대가 선을 넘도록 도발하고 그런 상황에서 기회를 잡아 처치를 따내서 승리하죠

translation.en: and they will take you and kill you and win the game through those situations.
translation.ko: 그런 상황에서 기회를 잡아 처치를 따내서 승리하죠

translation.en: [Toby] Trouble in the mid lane again. There's already the Gush.
translation.ko: 중부 전선이 또 위험해요 분출은 이미 썼습니다

translation.en: 357, PLT, everyone is right on top of Dendi.
He's in the wrong place.
And the way Na'Vi played, they really gambled basically.
Dendi's really been ganked, just shut down.
And not a single kill to his name as well.
Now Na'Vi gonna assault inside the base.
translation.ko: 이제 Na'Vi가 기지 안으로 공격해 들어갑니다

translation.en: Watch Artstyle. Tier 3 tower. VS Swap! Artstyle's in the wrong place!
translation.ko: Artstyle 선수, 3차 포탑입니다 복수 혼령, 황천의 이동술! 자리를 잘못 잡았어요! 파멸의 사도도 있네요!

translation.en: Doom there as well! BKB's both popping off!
translation.ko: 자리를 잘못 잡았어요! 파멸의 사도도 있네요! 칠흑왕의 지팡이 두 개가 켜집니다

translation.en: Ravage will pop from LighTofHeaveN unable to affect EHOME.
translation.ko: LighTofHeaveN이 재해를 썼는데 EHOME이 안 맞네요

translation.en: Pudge will go down. They wanna be initiated on.
Na'Vi, they need to fall back.
[Clement] They take your little upsets
and just win the game through those mistakes.
[Toby] GG from Na'Vi!
EHOME is celebrating right now inside the booth. Na'Vi cannot believe it!
translation.ko: EHOME이 부스 안에서 기뻐합니다 Na'Vi는 이 상황이 믿기지 않죠

translation.en: They've dominated this tournament up till now, and EHOME takes the first match so convincingly.
translation.ko: 지금까지는 Na'Vi가 우세했지만 첫 경기는 EHOME이 가져갑니다

translation.en: [Liu] That was the first loss of Na'Vi during the whole tournament.
translation.ko: 이번 대회 전체를 통틀어 Na'Vi가 처음으로 졌죠

translation.en: They went undefeated until the Grand Final.
[Toby] We're gonna have a 15-minute break and be right back here soon.
Na'Vi, they need to compose themselves.
EHOME, well, they just need to be awesome. What a play by them!
translation.ko: EHOME은 그냥… 잘하면 됩니다 엄청난 경기력을 보여 줬습니다!

translation.en: [Dendi] Any loss actually makes me pretty sad.
We tried to put family pictures here.
This is our mom and dad.
And I think that this one is our favorite actually.
translation.ko: 우리 가족은 이 사진을 제일 좋아해요

translation.en: My childhood, we lived a poor life,
and Dad was working for all our lives.
[Artem] But he helped us every time and every problem.
I just ask him and he'll do everything for me,
translation.ko: 제가 말만 하면 뭐든지 다 해 주셨죠

translation.en: for Katya, for Danil as well.
[Artem] But Danil and Father were like friends.
[Irina, in Russian] Indeed my husband was simply
a fanatical fisherman.
[Irina, in Russian] Danil was, I would say, his best student.
Danil has the same patience and control as his dad.
He could sit for hours and watch the bobber
translation.ko: 미동도 안 하는 찌를 몇 시간씩 지켜봤죠

translation.en: that wouldn't even twitch.
[Katya] They could sit with no speaking for hours.
translation.ko: 몇 시간 동안 한마디도 안 한 채로 앉아서

translation.en: And just enjoy each other's company.
They understood each other without words.
[Dendi] One day I was going fishing, but Dad never showed up.
translation.ko: 하루는 낚시하러 가는데… 아빠가 오지 않으셨어요

translation.en: When I came home it was already super late.
translation.ko: 제가 집으로 돌아왔을 땐 너무 늦었었죠

translation.en: He was feeling bad.
He went to the hospital.
He decided to…
stay for a few weeks, you know, so we watch everything, stuff like this.
translation.ko: 몇 주간 입원하기로 결정이 돼서 저희가 다 같이 간호했죠

translation.en: [Dendi] And, uh… cancer.
It was a very big shock for me because he was very thin.
I cannot understand that this is my father.
[Artem] We were all sure that it must be okay.
But, uh, it was a very short time.
I was really sad and was crying a lot.
I was upset about I couldn't say to him, many times, how much I loved him.
translation.ko: 얼마나 사랑하는지 많이 얘기해 드리지 못해서 정말 화가 났어요

translation.en: [Irina, Russian] After his dad passed away, he hasn't gone fishing once.
translation.ko: 남편이 떠난 후로 다닐은 낚시하러 안 가더군요

translation.en: Not even once. For now, this is all in the past.
translation.ko: 단 한 번도요 지금으로선 이제 다 지난 일이에요

translation.en: Actually, I spent more time near the computer
because I could not think about it.
translation.ko: 아버지에 대해 생각하지 않으려고 더 컴퓨터에 매달렸어요

translation.en: It's like a distractor.
It was like a start time, actually.
[Dendi] The push to play more.
translation.ko: 게임을 더 많이 하는 동기가 되었죠

translation.en: And that's maybe one of the reasons why I'm playing now.
translation.ko: 아마 지금 게임을 하는 이유일지도 모르겠네요

translation.en: Maybe I wouldn't play at all.
translation.ko: 어쩌면 게임을 아예 안 했을지도 모르니까요

translation.en: [Katya] The relationship of Danil and my mom grew stronger these days.
translation.ko: 다닐이랑 엄마는 최근에 사이가 더 좋아졌어요

translation.en: They support each other and they are very good friends.
translation.ko: 서로 힘이 되어 주죠 아주 좋은 친구 같아요

translation.en: I think that this is very important for Danil.
[Dendi] You know, five years ago, I wouldn't care about many things.
Now, I'm thinking about it a lot.
Something knocks you down, you need to learn to get up.
So I'm trying to research this.
To learn to get up.
[Dendi] It's the most important moment in my life
translation.ko: 지금이 제 인생에서 가장 중요한 순간이에요

translation.en: because everything I worked on wasn't useful.
translation.ko: 제가 했던 건 다 잘 안됐거든요

translation.en: And now I have a chance to win this tournament for my family.
translation.ko: 가족을 위해서 우승할 기회가 온 거니까요

translation.en: So we have currently EHOME and Na'Vi playing in the Grand Finals.
translation.ko: "EHOME 이기자" 현재 EHOME과 Na'Vi가 결승전을 치르고 있습니다

translation.en: Na'Vi just lost one game versus EHOME and it's 1-1.
So both teams have to win two matches in order to win the one million dollars.
translation.ko: 백만 달러를 차지하려면 두 팀 다 두 번 이겨야 해요

translation.en: Because our picks looked completely different, we were like passive and stuff.
translation.ko: 완전히 다른 영웅을 골랐죠 좀 소극적으로 되었달까요

translation.en: People thought, like, we lost the first game, we're gonna lose the second game.
translation.ko: 첫 경기에서 지면 두 번째도 질 거 같잖아요

translation.en: [Clement] We were maybe a little bit demoralized.
We really needed to change to a different pick.
We were missing something.
[Dmitry, in Russian] We picked Enigma
just to have a strong team fight a five versus five combat.
translation.ko: 한타에 힘을 실으려고요 제대로 5대5 싸움을 해보려는 거였죠

translation.en: It was, like, the last hero left and I never played it before.
translation.ko: 마지막 남은 영웅이었는데 한 번도 안 해 본 거였어요

translation.en: [Clement] Then, we're, like, "Dendi, you go!"
And he's, like, "Guys, I've never played it!
translation.ko: 그러니까 한 번도 안 해 봤다더니

translation.en: But, I can do it!"
[Clement] So we took the risk of taking him
and risking maybe playing him badly.
translation.ko: 그 영웅을 제대로 못 할 위험을 감수한 거죠

translation.en: [Toby] So it looks like down on that bottom lane, Dendi will be taking the Enigma.
It is gonna be a very, very rough lane…
translation.ko: 아주아주 힘겨운 전선이 될 것 같군요

translation.en: Na'Vi lost the game.
And they're playing something now that they're not as confident with.
translation.ko: 이젠 자신이 없는 채로 경기에 임합니다

translation.en: EHOME figured out Na'Vi. Figured out how to play against it.
translation.ko: EHOME은 Na'Vi를 상대하는 방법을 완전히 파악했어요

translation.en: And I'm gonna stick to my word and I'm gonna say EHOME will win it.
translation.ko: 저는 역시 EHOME이 승리할 것 같습니다

translation.en: It was incredibly ballsy from Dendi to do that,
on the verge of winning the million dollars for your team.
translation.ko: Dendi가 정말 말도 안 되는 배짱을 부린 셈이죠

translation.en: [in Chinese] That's very stupid.
That's suicidal.
[Toby] Dendi really now caught out.
He's in trouble. Rockets to fly in.
FCB long way in on the tower, lands the stun.
translation.ko: FCB가 포탑 근처 깊숙이 파고들어 와 기절시킵니다

translation.en: Tinker just lasers him to death. It will cost FCB his life.
translation.ko: 땜장이가 레이저로 처리합니다 FCB도 같이 죽었군요

translation.en: [Clement] Then we made some little mistakes.
We played a really semi-type of, like, "turtle" strategy.
